results.title: Bookmaker's progress
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Barrie Howells, Marrin Canell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film on the Quebec publishing scene in general, and on Robert Davies’ Les Editions l’Etincelle in particular. Davies, an Anglophone publishing French books, is attempting to expand into the international marketplace without sacrificing his own integrity. He discusses the difficulties of survival in the limited Quebec book market, and is shown at work in Montreal, Paris and at the Frankfurt Book Fair.

results.title: Born of fire
results.creator_credit: Linda Reavely, WQED and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Although the continents seem stationary, they are actually moving gradually each year. Follow scientists around the world as they search for clues to the causes of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. The video takes us to Iceland where new and recent volcanoes have emerged, and to Africa, Japan, California and Santorini to record what happens when the “plates” which make up the world’s surface move and crash together.

results.title: Boogie nights
results.creator_credit: Paul Thomas Anderson, John Lyons, Lloyd Levin and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Director Paul Thomas Anderson’s second feature is a sprawling, kinetic tribute to the excesses of the 70’s porn industry.”Boogie Nights” follows the rise and fall of Dirk Diggler (Mark Wahlberg), a porn superstar known for his enormous ‘talent’ and loosely based on real life porn actor John Holmes. The film imagines the porn scene as your average dysfuntional family, headed by patriarch Burt Reynolds, an adult film director with lofty ambitions to make quality entertainment. “Boogie Nights” apparent nostalgia for a long gone era is realised via the death of the 16mm porn film, which was replaced by video, a cheaper, mass produced format that changed the industry forever. All this jammed in between one endless party after another, which comes to a sad, abrupt holt once it reaches the 80’s. The excellent ensemble cast includes Julianne Moore, Heather Graham, Don Cheadle, John C. Reilly, William H. Macy, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Luis Guzman, Burt Reynolds, Mark Wahlberg.

results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.

results.title: Bonsai: the art of training dwarfed potted trees
results.brief_description: An examination of Bonsai with some background on its origins. In this film prize specimens of Bonsai are viewed, trees are observed in their natural state and step-by-step demonstrations of the art and technique are shown.

results.title: Bonsai for the Beginner (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Bonsai is the art of training and growing living dwarf trees in containers. The art originated in China, over 1,000 years ago. “Bonsai”, (the Japanese word for “tray planted”) has been developed and perfected in Japan since the 14th century. Thousands of people throughout the world participate in the beautiful ancient art of Bonsai. Now for the first time easy step by step instructions are revealed for you to create your own living Bonsai. Presented by Georgina Kretschmar.

results.title: Born Free
results.creator_credit: James Hill, Paul Radin and Sam Jaffe
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all animal films, “Born Free” is based on the real life adventures of Joy Adamson, her husband, and the lion cub, Elsa. Filmed in spectacular African settings, accompanied by an Oscar winning score, “Born Free” is a movie for the entire family. The film sensitively portrays the painful conflict faced by the Adamsons who find they are no longer able to keep the growing Elsa as a pet. Rather than send her to the zoo, they decide to train her for a return to her natural life. Rated G

results.title: Bonnie and clyde [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Warren Beatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alternating between comedy and tragedy, this violent and kinetic re-telling of the story of Bonnie and Clyde is justifiably one of the most celebrated American films of the sixties. Set in the early thirties of the Depression, a car thief and his girl-friend commit a series of robberies which earn them a reputation as America’s most feared criminals. Featuring superb production values and brilliant editing, Arthur Penn’s film is an ironic exploration of the romantic roots of the counter-culture in the myths and memories of the Depression, and within Hollywood’s depictions of the “outlaw”. The film’s controversial use of violence is simultaneously brutal and liberating. Cast includes Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway and Gene Hackman.

results.title: Borderline
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of conflict and rebellion in a teenage girl that, to a large degree, typifies the problems of emotional adjustment experienced by many adolescents in their striving towards maturity. We meet Nora Fenton, a disturbed 15-year-old girl who, because of her persistent defiance of parental authority and self-injurious behavior, is sent to a remedial home for problem adolescents. As the film reviews Nora’s problems, we see how understanding, affection and firm parental guidance are th factors most needed in helping teenagers weather their most turbulent years.

results.title: Bonnie and Clyde (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Warren Beatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alternating between comedy and tragedy this violent and kinetic re-telling of the story of Bonnie and Clyde is justifiably one of the most celebrated American films of the sixties. Set in the early thirties of the Depression, a car thief and his girl-friend commit a series of robberies which earn them a reputation as America’s most feared criminals. Featuring superb production values and brilliant editing, Arthur Penn’s film is an ironic exploration of the romantic roots of the counter-culture in the myths and memories of the Depression and within Hollywood depictions of the “outlaw”. The film’s controversial use of violence is simultaneously brutal and liberating. With Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway and Gene Hackman.
